intro: Tephroseris spathulifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
